channel.title: Need help with find color spiral
channel.description: I plan on makin my first script a script for defend your castle. I figured a basic findcolorspiral with some mouse command would work. Unforunately...I found a problem. I was going to make the find color spiral go for the gray area of the stick figures heads. THis would have worked but the door to the castle is the same color. So basicly I'm wondering how can I make findcolorspiral only apply to one area.

item.title: Need help with find color spiral
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

numbers,
eg.

[code]program find;
var
x,y: integer;

begin
if FindColorSpiral(X, Y, 0, 50, 50, 100, 100) then
Writeln('Found Colour 0 at ’ + IntToStr(X) + ', ’ + IntToStr(Y));
end.[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with find color spiral

item.title: Need help with find color spiral
item.dc:creator: @da_boom_king da_boom_king
item.description:
@da_boom_king wrote:

[quote=“exps35, post:2, topic:134773”][quote]function FindColorSpiral(var x, y: Integer; color, xs, ys, xe, ye: Integer): Boolean;
Find color in box specified by xs, ys, xe, ye but start from x,y.[/quote]

Put the start coordinates in for xs,ys and the end coordinates for xe,ye[/quote]

so am I making xs,ys,xe, and ye variables or replacing those with the numbers?

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with find color spiral

item.title: Need help with find color spiral
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

function FindColorSpiral(var x, y: Integer; color, xs, ys, xe, ye: Integer): Boolean; Find color in box specified by xs, ys, xe, ye but start from x,y.

Put the start coordinates in for xs,ys and the end coordinates for xe,ye

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with find color spiral
